node.plaintext:
https://www.kdnuggets.com/2018/06/step-forward-feature-selection-python.html

https://aaronlelevier.github.io/intro-to-graphs/

Just came across this site full of interesting datasets: https://t.co/Plcfp0Oaxq 
 could be perfect for practice on #dataviz
[https://twitter.com/hashtag/dataviz?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw]  skills!

â€” Nathan Cheever (@data_cheeves) June 18, 2018
[https://twitter.com/data_cheeves/status/1008545580887334913?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw]
The sooner, the better! Skynet's not gonna build itself (well, arguably it will
after a certain point, but it'll take work to get it to that point! And that's
also something of a philosophical question regarding self-organization and
emergence). 
https://offspring.lifehacker.com/teach-your-kid-machine-learning-with-these-free-lessons-1826836113

Posted before, but now with updates! http://www.fharrell.com/post/stat-ml/
node.html:
https://www.kdnuggets.com/2018/06/step-forward-feature-selection-python.html

https://aaronlelevier.github.io/intro-to-graphs/

Just came across this site full of interesting datasets: https://t.co/Plcfp0Oaxq could be perfect for practice on #dataviz skills!

— Nathan Cheever (@data_cheeves) June 18, 2018

The sooner, the better! Skynet's not gonna build itself (well, arguably it will after a certain point, but it'll take work to get it to that point! And that's also something of a philosophical question regarding self-organization and emergence). https://offspring.lifehacker.com/teach-your-kid-machine-learning-with-these-free-lessons-1826836113

Posted before, but now with updates! http://www.fharrell.com/post/stat-ml/

tags.name: Data Vis
tags.description: Visualize your data with charting tools like Matplotlib, Plotly, D3, Chart.js, Muze, Seaborn, and countless others. Primarily focused on programmatic visualization as opposed to Business Intelligence software.

http://hookedondata.org/Advice-for-Applying-to-Data-Science-Jobs/

SUPER USEFUL, especially for those of us who learned the analytics part first
and picked up coding second. 
https://drivendata.github.io/cookiecutter-data-science/

whoa. 
https://www.vox.com/2018/6/13/17449118/stanford-prison-experiment-fraud-psychology-replication

https://opensource.com/article/18/5/bash-tricks

https://medium.com/@enjalot/the-trouble-with-d3-4a84f7de011f

node.plaintext:
Mom: "Yes, it was actually me!"
Me: "I know. I saw the code."
Me: "Quote: We are not quite sure what it's doing, but it's called daily and
runs since 1985 without a change."

â€” Rem0te (@grauhut) May 28, 2018
[https://twitter.com/grauhut/status/1001020570664886273?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw]
https://towardsdatascience.com/embedding-machine-learning-models-to-web-apps-part-1-6ab7b55ee428

https://www.manning.com/books/exploring-data-with-python

https://www.citusdata.com/blog/2018/06/01/fun-with-sql-window-functions-in-postgresql/

https://lispcast.com/avoid-naming-at-all-costs/
node.html:
Mom: "Yes, it was actually me!"
Me: "I know. I saw the code."
Me: "Quote: We are not quite sure what it's doing, but it's called daily and runs since 1985 without a change."

— Rem0te (@grauhut) May 28, 2018

https://towardsdatascience.com/embedding-machine-learning-models-to-web-apps-part-1-6ab7b55ee428

https://www.manning.com/books/exploring-data-with-python

https://www.citusdata.com/blog/2018/06/01/fun-with-sql-window-functions-in-postgresql/

https://lispcast.com/avoid-naming-at-all-costs/

node.plaintext:
Algorithms as IKEA instructions:
https://idea-instructions.com/

An Augmented Reality Microscope for Cancer Detection
https://research.googleblog.com/2018/04/an-augmented-reality-microscope.html

Super into everything about this - using AI to help enforce financial
regulations
https://www.oreilly.com/ideas/simon-moss-on-using-artificial-intelligence-to-fight-financial-crimes

Yay mutants
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/apr/16/scientists-accidentally-create-mutant-enzyme-that-eats-plastic-bottles

Cool tools for cool tasks!
http://ataspinar.com/2018/04/04/machine-learning-with-signal-processing-techniques/
